bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Henry Rose Carter, April 3, 1901

div1.p: Reed sends a reprint that Carter has requested, along with some other literature. He expresses interest in reading two articles, written by Carter, that have been recently published.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Henry Rose Carter, April 3, 1901
div1.opener:
Commissioner of Accounts and Commissioner in
Chancery of Circuit Court of Hanover County
H. CARTER REDD
ATTORNEY-AT-LAW
1104 TRAVELERS BUILDING
RICHMOND, VA.
WAR DEPARTMENT
SURGEON GENERALS OFFICE
Army Medical Museum and Library
Washington,
April 3rd. 1901
My dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I have been waiting for the receipt of some
Reprinting of our Preliminary Note before replying to your last
letter. I take much pleasure in sending forward a copy to-day
together with some other literature which may be of interest.

I looked in The Journal of the American Med. Association for
the article you spoke of in your letter, but couldn't find it.

Have you a copy or can you give me the date of the Journal?
Carroll has just called my attention to your paper in the Med.
Record, which I shall read to-day with much interest.
